    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        This contains all the things necessary in the interface that the user uses. First it creates any variables that are needed. Then it sets up the lists as new arrays and fills them with null pointers. Then it checks to see if there is a save file, and if there is, then the program sets the lists as the ones from the save file. Then the user is given 6 options to choose from in the main menu. These options are, to add an animal to the registry, to see the lists, to search for an appointment, to search for medical history, to save, or to quit.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • appSearchOwner

        private static Appointment appSearchOwner(String name)
        This method will search the appointment list by owner. it is recursive, so it will use the aid of the search helper method, so as to help in the binary search
        Parameters:
        name - The name you are looking for in the array
        Returns:
        the appointment you are looking for, or null if it doesn't exist

      • searchHelperOwner

        private static Appointment searchHelperOwner(String name,
                            int low,
                            int high)
        This method will recursively call itself until either the appointment is found, or you reach the end, in which case null will be passed back. It uses the basic binary search mechanic to search for the appointment you want.
        Parameters:
        name - The name you are looking for
        low - The bottom border of the binary search
        high - The top border of the binary search
        Returns:
        Either the appointment or null

      • appSearchDate

        This method will search the appointment list by date. it is recursive, so it will use the aid of the search helper method, so as to help in the binary search
        Parameters:
        date - The date you are looking for in the array
        Returns:
        the appointment you are looking for, or null if it doesn't exist

        This method will recursively call itself until either the appointment is found, or you reach the end, in which case null will be passed back. It uses the basic binary search mechanic to search for the appointment you want.

      • searchHelperName

        private static Animal searchHelperName(String name,
                      int low,
                      int high)
        This method will recursively call itself until either the animal is found, or you reach the end, in which case null will be passed back. It uses the basic binary search mechanic to search for the animal you want.
        Parameters:
        name - The name you are looking for
        low - The bottom border of the binary search
        high - The top border of the binary search
        Returns:
        Either the appointment or null

        private static Animal searchHelperAnimOwner(String name,
                           int low,

        This method will recursively call itself until either the animal is found, or you reach the end, in which case null will be passed back. It uses the basic binary search mechanic to search for the animal you want.

        low - The bottom border of the binary search
        high - The top border of the binary search
        Returns:
        Either the appointment or null

      • animSize

        public static int animSize()
        First, this method will make a temporary variable temp and make it equal to 0. Then it will check the animal array, and if the ith variable is not null, it will add 1 to temp. When a null pointer is found, then it will break the for loop, and return the temp number. This temp will be how many variables are in the array that are not null.
        Returns:
        temp, which is the number of non-null variables in the array

      • appSize

        public static int appSize()
        First, this method will make a temporary variable temp and make it equal to 0. Then it will check the appointment array, and if the ith variable is not null, it will add 1 to temp. When a null pointer is found, then it will break the for loop, and return the temp number. This temp will be how many variables are in the array that are not null.
        Returns:
        temp, which is the number of non-null variables in the array

      • subtractAppointment

        public static void subtractAppointment(Appointment a)
        This will take in an appointment and check all of the appointment array for that appointment. If it is found, then it will make that appointment equal to the appointment in the next cell, and will continuously move them down one by one until all the appointments are moved one cell to the left. It will then make the last cell into null, so to complete the subtraction of the appointment a.
        Parameters:
        a - The appointment you wish to subtract

      • addAppointment

        public static void addAppointment(Appointment a)
        This will add an appointment to the appointment array in the next available spot in the array, which would be at appSize()
        Parameters:
        a - Is the Appointment being added to the appointment array

      • addAnimal

        public static void addAnimal(Animal a)
        This will add an animal to the animal array in the next available spot in the array, which would be at animSize()
        Parameters:
        a - Is the Animal being added to the animal array

      • printAppointment

        public static void printAppointment()
        This will print no appointments if there are none, and all the appointments if there are some. It will also increment them on screen as appointment 1, appointment 2, etc.

      • printAnimal

        private static void printAnimal()
        This will print no animals if there are none, and all the animals if there are some. It will also increment them on screen as animal 1, animal 2, etc.

      • getInput

        public static int getInput()
        Used to make sure that only ints are being entered for the parts where ints are needed.
        Returns:
        the response of the user, or 10 if it's not an int.

      • saveIt

        public static void saveIt(Save saveState,
          Animal[] anim,
          Appointment[] app)
        This will save the two lists in the save object, and make a file, saved.dat, so that you can load it at a later time.
        Parameters:
        saveState - The save object needed to save the lists
        anim - the animal list.
        app - the appointment list.
